Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Likewise \Like"wise`\ (l[imac]k"w[imac]z`), adv. & conj. [See {Wise}, n.] In like manner; also; moreover; too. See {Also}. [1913 Webster]
Go, and do thou likewise. --Luke x. 37. [1913 Webster]
For he seeth that wise men die; likewise the fool and the brutish person perish. --Ps. xlix. 10. [1913 Webster]

likewise adv 1: in like or similar manner; "He was similarly affected"; "some people have little power to do good, and have likewise little strength to resist evil"- Samuel Johnson [syn: {similarly}] 2: in addition; "he has a Mercedes, too" [syn: {besides}, {too}, {also}, {as well}] 3: equally; "parents and teachers alike demanded reforms" [syn: {alike}]
